result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyus M Cornelius

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyus M Cornelius in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Tyus M Cornelius.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State places offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer.  Parties stipulate to the use of 911 call. Motion in limine from parties addressed on the record. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 36.
Motion to Admit 911 Call.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Requested Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed. nk
State's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Tyus M Cornelius in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Tyus M Cornelius.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Court scheduling order, signed and filed. Case adjourned, Branch 36.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling Order

Defendant Tyus M Cornelius in court in person with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appeared by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Wilckens.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Lori Kuehn

Court ordered no contact with Daniel D.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Tyus M Cornelius in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Tyus M Cornelius in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyus M Cornelius appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
